name: Donate
description:
Established in Columbus Ohio, Global Gallery is a volunteer based, non-profit organization dedicated to promoting Fair Trade handcrafted products from around the world while developing cultural enrichment through educational workshops and social events.

Fair Trade is not about charity, but about giving a fair deal to marginalized third world producers. The best way to support them is to buy Fair Trade products, and Global Gallery's store is there to market those products from third world countries; however, Global Gallery's educational work to spread the vital message about the importance of Fair Trade depends on donations and grants. We appreciate your generous donation of any amount.

To donate more than $1 please increase your quantity at checkout.

name: Shea Butter Bar Soap
description:
Known as "women's gold" in some parts of West Africa, Shea is a wild nut with natural healing properties. Including Vitamins A&E, Shea helps diminish wrinkles, moisturize and repair many kinds of skin damage. 

Not for use by those with nut allergies. 

Not tested on animals. For external use only.

Made in Ghana

World Peaces LLC

WPG37

name: Palam Fragrant Soaps
description: Handmade soap is carefully crafted from natural vegetable oils by traditional Indian soapmakers. The fragrance of these soaps from Palam Rural Centre is unique, derived from herbs, roots, leaves or flowers, blended to aromatic perfection. Attractively boxed, making the perfect small gift. · Hand made · 3Lx2Wx1H inches Made in India About the artists: Palam Rural Centre offers employment opportunities to people of the marginalized Harijan caste community in southeastern India. Harijan people were traditionally leather workers, but had little ability to market their skills in their limited environment and were forced to take low-wage agricultural jobs before the centre opened in 1978. Palam Rural Centre seeks to build a “bridge” to the markets of the rest of the world, thus helping the Harijan people to support themselves through export sales. Scented Soap Production In recent years the leather trade in India has gained momentum with the influx of large multinational companies, whose latest technologies have caused highly inflated prices for raw hides. Small traditional tanneries have been squeezed from the industry. Although Palam has struggled as well, their commitment to the harijans encouraged the development of new designs for leather products. After four years of careful planning, Palam has developed vegetable oil based bath soaps as a product alternative. Vegetable oils are mixed in the correct proportion for the type of soap being produced. These oils are heated to separate the impurities from the oil. This heating and straining process occurs three times. Next the oil mixture is cooled and formed as a solid block. As the oil mixture hardens insoluble impurities collect at the top and bottom of the block. Those collected at the top are called the crust and those at the bottom of the block are called nigre. The solidified portion between the crust and nigre is known as neat and serves as the base for making bath soaps. The crust and nigre are used in making laundry soap. A block of neat is dried and when the moisture content is just right the block is cut into bars and fed into a chipping machine to make soap chips. The chips are air-dried and then blended with the perfumes and dyes in an amalgamator. Then the soap is milled which further blends the soap,perfumes and dyes while also reducing the mixture to ribbons of soap. The soap ribbons are moved to the plodder, which compresses the ribbons into the desired shape. The soap is then cut into bars and weighed by hand. Each bar of soap is embossed with the word, Palam, on one side and the same word in the Tamil language on the other side. These soaps are being marketed with confidence that Palam is committed to creating employment opportunities for underemployed people in India. Product Code: #6896260

name: Beecology Foaming Moisturizing Hand Soap
description:
Beecology knows what you want in an SLS-free All-Natural Foaming Hand Soap: luxurious lather, an intoxicating scent, and gentle but effective cleansing power. We've wrapped these elements into every Foaming Hand Soapl we make.
 
These fabulous Foaming Hand Soaps begin with pure oils and other simple cleansing and moisturizing ingredients; the perfect blend of natural fragrances adds the finishing touch. Choose from peppermint, grapefruit and lemongrass, and lavender and bergamot to find an SLS-free body wash that suits your fancy.
 
With no worries about artificial color or chemical preservatives, you'll be able enjoy the guilt-free pleasure of each Beecology Foaming Hand Washes.

BC2

name: Beecology Body Wash
description:
Beecology knows what you want in an SLS-free body wash: luxurious lather, an intoxicating scent, and gentle but effective cleansing power. We've wrapped these elements into every natural shower gel we make.
 
These fabulous body washes begin with pure oils and other simple cleansing and moisturizing ingredients; the perfect blend of natural fragrances adds the finishing touch. Choose from peppermint, grapefruit and lemongrass, and lavender and bergamot to find an SLS-free body wash that suits your fancy.
 
With no worries about artificial color or chemical preservatives, you'll be able enjoy the guilt-free pleasure of each Beecology natural shower gel.

BC6

name: Beecology Shampoo and Conditioner
description:
All natural shampoos are not the same, and when it comes to performance Beecology's sulfate-free shampoo outshines all the rest. We go beyond simply safe with a recipe of pure ingredients that delivers healthy, soft, touchable hair. We have never made our natural shampoos from sulfates or parabens, both of which can damage your hair and skin. Instead we craft our sulfate-free shampoo - and its coordinating natural conditioner - from botanicals such as honey, chamomile, and yarrow. Beecology sulfate-free shampoo replenishes and nourishes your hair the way nature intended.

Just as your body feels better when you nourish it with natural foods, your hair feels better when you soften it with a natural hair conditioner. Beecology uses only the purest ingredients to create our natural hair moisturizer. The combination of flavonoids, exotic proteins, and nature’s oils will strengthen and nourish your hair like no other natural hair conditioner on the market. Use it after Beecology’s sulfate-free shampoo to bring out the shiny, silky best in your hair every time you shower.

Shampoo- BC4
Conditioner- BC5

name: Messenger Bags
description:
These are messenger bags with symbolic, hand appliquéd motifs on the front flap. This particular series is comprised of the Tree of Life. It is a quilted bag with a big pocket inside, made by artisans in India. They use locally grown, unbleached and un-dyed cotton, making this bag environmentally friendly and giving it a rustic appeal.

Made in India

About the Artists: The series is made by an all-female cooperative in the draught-affected Marwar region of West Rajasthan, India. The cooperative is made of 272 women actively practicing this art. The artisans are distributed over the region in various villages. Women from far villages come once a week to the cooperative office, submit their products and collect more raw materials to take back to their homes to work on them. Profits from this art help in the overall development of the group. This region now has medical centers providing basic health services, electricity produced from solar energy, evening schools for children and vocational colleges for women. Thank you for your support!


Product Code: #HE29 #HEBag8 #HE49

options.name: White with Black Peace Sign Applique

name: Tree of Life Tote Bag
description:
These new additions to our collection are perfect colors and light-weight material for springtime. Coming in both a vibrant blue with a green sewn-on tree of life and a green with a lighter green tree of life, these totes are perfect for carrying groceries, personal belongings, books or traveling accessories. The appliquéd tree of life is only on one side of the tote. Both colors come with a snap to close the bag and a small pocket on the inside big enough to hold keys, a cell phone, make-up or a passport. On the outside of the bag, there is a cell phone pocket (wide enough for a Blackberry or iPhone) that ties together with thin ropes. Its 3” depth allows it to sit flat if you place the tote on the floor.

Color: Blue and Green
Composition: Cotton
Size: 12” x 15” x 3”

Code: HE26

name: Bottle Cap Cluster Earrings
description:
Bead color will vary between yellow and black.

Made in Kenya

About the Artists: 
The sign for the Teenage Mothers Association of Kenya (TEMAK) indicates that it is "the last house towards the Obunga slums," the most destitute area of Kisumu. Many of the unwed mothers and young girls who come to TEMAK to learn job skills live in these slums. TEMAK is an organization that offers job training in tailoring, hairdressing, secretarial skills, craft making, and recently, access to computers for unwed mothers, girls, and others in the Obunga slum community. As a community center, the organization also provides the community with an educational forum for HIV/AIDS awareness and other health issues. Many of the young women at TEMAK participate in making crafts, thereby earning income to support themselves and their families. In the past few years, TEMAK has also become a craft center for the artisans and craftspeople in the town of Kisumu by providing local and international sales outlets that make available a sustainable income for many in the community.

CGE19

name: String Heart Earrings
description:
Glossy double twisted string wrapped wire with tagua nut beads.

Made in Bolivia

About the Artists:
Ecological handcrafts from Bolivia honor the life of the rainforest through sustainable harvesting of rainforest seeds. Seeds include cesibieto de la palmera, acai, and jachirilla. Acai berries are known for their healthful properties, but the seed makes up 90% of the berry. By creating exquisitely simple adornments with these seeds, indigenous families support valuation of the forest and its precious resources. As rainforest resources are exploited by outside companies, projects like this small business help keep resources and decisions about those resources in the hands of those who have lived in its canopy for centuries. The purchase of this piece supports indigenous families’ microenterprises, the health of the forest and the spirit of its people.

WPB5

(Tagua nut should not be ingested)

name: Banana Leaf Perle Necklace
description:
This product is made from dried leaves of the banana tree that grow in abundance in the tropical regions of Central Africa. They are cut into strips and rolled into a variety of beautiful perles (beads). The familiar red mud is used to make clay beads in a small handcrafted kiln. The result is a treasured work of art and love.

Made in the Central African Republic

About the Artists: The artisans are part of a collaboration project at Project Hope and Charite (PHC) in the Central African Republic. The group is comprised of widows who are caring for orphans and orphans who have completed their basic education in the PHC program.

The goal of this Fair Trade project is to teach the skills to create beautiful and high quality jewelry using natural materials. It provides widows and orphans with the opportunity to make an income in a safe environment from readily available materials in a country where jobs are scarce. It also encourages skill development, creativity, hard work, and excellence. 

WPCAR2

name: Hope Bracelet/Anklet
description:
Handmade silver bracelet made by Tibetan migrant workers. Comes in an assortment of styles. 

Made in Tibet

About the Artists: Purchases of Peace Love Bling designs support women business owners and artists as well as causes that help disadvantaged women find stability and dignity for themselves and their families. It is a Columbus Ohio based, women owned business. Creative Director LeAnne Johnson Absalom lived and worked in Beijing for over four years where she was inspired by the astounding variety of natural pearls and stones available and the women who handcraft designs. These women are daughters of the cultural revolution who emerged from challenging experiences to own their own businesses and employ other women paying them a better than living wage and providing the tools and materials needed to create beautiful designs filled with pride and dignity.  Closer to home, Peace Love Bling actively supports Dress for Success and the Ohio Domestic Violence Network as well as other humanitarian efforts that are close to the hearts of our customers.

PB23

name: Recycled Poptab bracelet
description:
These whimsical bracelets add color, style and a clear statement to any collection. Look good while doing good.  

Made in Mexico

About the Artists: Imaginarte. The focus of BIO when it began in 1992 was educating Mexico in the need to protect and restore the environment. Working with women who live in several villages as an aspect of its education efforts, BIO helped designed bags and other functional products that are made from manufactured materials, reusing aluminum pop tops, rubber from tires and plastic billboards, as well as recycling paper and candy wrappers. The women are paid a fair price for each piece that they make, which promotes the beauty of handmade products while addressing one of the main causes of environmental deterioration in Mexico – poverty.

CGPOP1

Adjustable silver toned band. One size fits all.

name: Divine Chocolate
description: About the Producers: Divine chocolate is made from cocoa harvested by the Kuapa Kokoo co-op in Ghana, which was formed in the early 1900s to protect the rights of Ghanaian cocoa farmers. In 1997, they voted to form their own chocolate company, of which they own 45%, more than any other fair trade food producing company. Members of the cooperative are able to obtain management positions within the company and control their own fates. Profits have helped the farmers build schools, get clean drinking water, provide medical care to remote areas, and create programs to help generate income so that women can support their families outside of growing season. 100g bars White Chocolate with Strawberries Smooth white chocolate made from the creamiest cocoa butter with crunchy pieces of real strawberry crisp. Milk Chocolate Made with the finest cocoa, smooth cocoa butter and real vanilla giving it a distinctive creamy flavour. 70% Dark Chocolate Critically acclaimed, smooth, rich, dark chocolate. 70% Mint Dark Chocolate Smooth, rich, 70% dark chocolate with the inspired addition of crispy mint pieces and natural peppermint oil. Hazelnut Milk Chocolate Made with the finest cocoa, real vanilla and delicately roasted chopped hazelnuts. 70% Dark Chocolate with Raspberries Smooth, rich, 70% dark chocolate with the the fruity tartness of real raspberries. Product Code: #23015

options.name: 70% Dark Chocolate with Ginger and Orange

name: Grounds for Change Coffee
description: About the Producers: Grounds for Change is a certified organic coffee roaster specializing in 100% Fair Trade Coffee. Their coffee is Fair Trade Certified by TransFairUSA, Organic Certified by the Washington State Department of Agriculture and grown in shaded conditions. Through their partnerships with Grounds for Change, coffee growers in several different countries throughout Central America have been able to institute powerful positive social change, such as preventing the use of land for growing coca and poppies, used to make illegal drugs, making it possible for local students to attend college for the first time in their communities, creating sexual health education programs to prevent the spread of the virus that causes cervical cancer, and helping farmers to elevate their production to the level required for fair trade certification so that they can benefit as well. Global Gallery is proud to carry several varieties of Grounds for Change organic, Fair Trade coffees (**Note all bags are 12oz whole bean): Cafe Femenino Peru Out of Peru comes a story of strength, unity and hope. A new niche coffee, Cafe Femenino Peru, has evolved that is changing the role of women in rural coffee communities. Female coffee growers have become better educated, organized, and for the first time are producing women's coffee as a specialty commodity. This Fair Trade and organic certified coffee is grown, processed and traded exclusively by women. The women then decide how to use the additional funds to better their lives and those of their children. Cafe Femenino Peru is a medium bodied coffee with a fine acidity, sweet aroma and hints of baker's chocolate that are accentuated by a slow, dark roast. We know that you will enjoy this unique coffee for its wonderful taste as well as for the special story that underlies its production. Classic Espresso Blend is a combination of five coffees that are balanced to deliver a smooth, yet spicy shot that is dark, distinctive and full-bodied but not bitter or smoky. This 100% arabica blend produces a thick, rich crema and is wonderful as a straight shot or blended with foamed milk. Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Fragrant and floral with wine and fruit overtones, the Yirgacheffe is one of the most prized East African coffees. When roasted to a medium-dark level, it has a smooth medium body and long, lingering finish. The Oromia Cooperative that produces this coffee is featured in the award-winning documentary Black Gold. We urge all of our customers to take the time to view this excellent film. Product Code: #gfc

name: Higher Grounds Coffee
description:
All bags are 16oz whole beans

Made in Colombia, Ethiopia, Mexico, Nicaragua, Peru, Sumatra, Uganda

Higher Grounds Trading Co. is a mission-driven company dedicated to offering you the highest-quality handcrafted 100% fair trade, organic, and shade-grown coffees from around the world. Each fair trade bean is small-batch roasted upon order and delivered fresh to you. Purchase of Higher Grounds products supports a list of charities, among them a project which provides clean drinking water to rural farmers in Mexico, and a program which helps support the education of the rural Ethiopian population to improve opportunities and living standards in the long term.

Product Code: #HGT

options.name: Organic Highland Humanity Blend 	 Organic Highland Humanity Blend

name: Peace Coffee
description: About the Producers: Peace Coffee was created after the Institute for Agriculture and Trade Policy met with a group of Mexican farmers in 1995 and realized the need for direct sales of fair trade coffee to support the growers. The company now supports several grower-owned co-ops as well as its own, Cooperative Coffees. With the support of Peace Coffee, growers have been able to generate further income by roasting their own beans to sell in local markets, investing in ecotourism, and creating skill-building and internship programs in their communities. 16oz bags of whole beans. ETHIOPIAN - Ethiopian Yirgacheffe Light Roast An amazing and unique coffee, roasted to showcase the characteristics found only in this origin. Roast Level: Light Acidity:High Body:Light-Medium Aroma:Lemon, bergamot, spice & mandarin orange Flavor Notes:spice, citrus & apricot NICARAGUAN - Nicaraguan Medium Roast Robust, sweet & smooth single origin coffee that also works well as an espresso. Roast Level: Medium Acidity:Low Body:Medium-Heavy Aroma: Spice, jasmine, vanilla & raisin Flavor Notes: Spice, nutty, cedar, earth & leather COLOMBIAN - Colombian Dark Roast A sweet dark roast. A smooth flavor and balanced cup. Roast Level: Medium-Dark Acidity: Low-Medium MPR BLEND - Minnesota Public Radio Blend: Peruvian & Sumatran This year Peace Coffee donated over a thousand pounds of coffee to Minnesota Public Radio. Our coffee was used to keep volunteers and radio hosts caffeinated through the last fund drive. It was also offered as a part of a gift item for all the wonderful people who pledged and became MPR members this year. We've gotten so many positive responses to the MPR Blend we decided to offer it online. This coffee blend, like the MPR stations, pleases everyone. It includes some of our Sumatran Full City(The News Station),Peruvian French Roast (The Current) and Peruvian Light Roast (The Classical Station) roasted beans. Set your morning alarm to MPR and your automatic coffee brewer to Peace Coffee! Body: Medium Aroma: Milk chocolate & spice Flavor Notes: Dark chocolate, caramel, cardamom & toasted walnuts COLOMBIAN - Colombian Heavy Pedal Roast A clean sweet light roast with a brisk finish and a mild berry/cherry aftertaste. Roast Level: Light Acidity: Medium-High Body: Medium Aroma: Cocoa, honey & almond Flavor Notes: Toasted walnuts, cocoa & wine-like Product Code: #PCBEAN

name: Choice Organic Tea
description:
Made in China, India, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Egypt, South Africa

About the Producers: Choice Organic Teas was founded in 1989 by Blake Rankin. It has since become the number one exclusive producer of certified organic teas in North America. It was the first tea maker in the United States to offer Fair Trade certified teas. The company is committed to environmentally sustainable practices in all aspects of production and business, even providing incentives to domestic employees to adopt these practices in their everyday lives. Workers on tea plantations and estates directly benefit from a fair trade relationship with Choice Tea. Workers set their own premiums to be paid by the company to support community programs of their choice, such as retirement funds, support for education, low-interest loans for equipment to help diversify income and HIV/AIDS education.

Jasmine Green Tea
A Chinese classic. Freshly-picked organic jasmine blossoms are mixed with organic green tea, and removed after leaving their ethereal, floral scent behind.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Moroccan Mint Green Tea
Blended from carefully selected organic green teas and the spearmint favored in North Africa. It is a vitalizing refreshment in the Saharan heat and has only half the caffeine of other green teas.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Green Tea with Essence of Peach
Asia's finest organic green teas, with their full complement of healthful polyphenols, are infused with the luscious overtones of ripe peaches.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Celtic Breakfast
A richly flavored and robust tea. Organic leaf from Assam provides a touch of malt, and Ceylon teas from mountain estates keep the blend smooth yet striking.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Chai Spice Black Tea
Our distinctive organic chai favors the rich Assam black teas of the Brahmaputra Valley, and highly-prized cardamom. Make this tea strong, and temper it with milk and sweetener.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Earl Grey with Lavender
Selected organic black teas from India and Ceylon are blended with bergamot, a Mediterranean citrus, and enhanced with organic lavender blossoms.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Mango Ceylon with Vanilla
Smooth, organic black Ceylon tea is flavored with the essence of mango and enriched with the undertones of organic Sumatra vanilla. A delightful tea to serve on ice.
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Chamomile Spearmint with Bergamot
Organic chamomile and spearmint, appreciated for their soothing comforts, are infused with organic bergamot, the Mediterranean citrus used to perfume Earl Grey teas. [Caffeine-free]
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Rooibos (Red Bush Tea) + Vanilla
The result of fermenting the needle-like leaves of this native South African bush. Organic rooibos is abundantly flavorful; full-bodied with a sweet earthy aroma, made more luxuriant with the addition of tropical, organic vanilla. Rich in minerals and antioxidants. [Caffeine-free]
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags 	

Northwest Blackberry
Organic herbs, leaves and berries are infused with the richness of blackberry, providing a delightful cup of tea. A celebration of field and forest. Exceptional served over ice and sweetened with organic apple juice! [Caffeine-free]
Fair Trade / 20 tea bags

options.name: Green Tea with Essence of Peach

name: Women's Bean Project Soup Mixes
description: Delicious mixes in the following flavors: FIREHOUSE HOT CHILLI:TONI'S TEN BEAN SOUP: The symphony of flavors and textures combined with just a hint of spice give this soup a hearty flavor. You add the tomatoes. You can also add meats or vegetables to make it more of a stew.The 10 beans are layered for an attractive presentation to a hostess or your favorite chef. Just add water, tomatoes and garlic, great for crock pots or stove top, serves 6, wholesome and satisfying, great with Women's Bean Project Golden Cornbread, kosher certified Ingredients: barley, anasazi beans, lentils, red lentils, green split peas, yellow split peas, black eyed peas, black turtle beans, red and white beans, Yellow split peas, salt, parsley, garlic, paprika and cayenne pepper SARAH'S SPICY SPLIT PEA SOUP: The unique blend of curry and coriander add spice to this otherwise sweet and creamy soup. Rich in fiber, iron and protein, as well as low in fat, the humble pea never fails to please the palate. Mild curry flavor, kosher certified OLD FASHIONED MILD CHILI: Mildly spiced with cumin and chili pepper, this red bean chili reminds you of the comforts of home. Goes nicely with our Golden Cornbread. Mild spices, great for crock pots or stove top, serves 6, wholesome and satisfying, great with Women's Bean Project Golden Cornbread, kosher certified Ingredients: red beans and spices including parsley, chili pepper and cumin. Ingredients: green split peas and spices including curry, garlic powder, coriander and crushed red pepper. MARIAN'S BLACK BEAN SOUP: Our black beans make this earthy soup delicious and nutritious. The tough shell holds its shape during cooking while the inside cooks to a velvety mushroom taste. A classic. Great for crock pots or stove top, serves 6, wholesome and satisfying, great with Women's Bean Project Golden Cornbread, kosher certified Ingredients: black turtle beans and spices including parsley, cumin and oregano. Made in the U.S. About the Producers: Since 1989, Women's Bean Project has been dedicated to helping women break the cycle of poverty and unemployment. Its mission is to change women's lives by providing stepping stones to self-sufficiency through social enterprise. Women’s Bean Project strives to break the cycle of chronic unemployment and poverty by helping women discover their talents and develop skills by offering job readiness training opportunities. With this stepping stone toward success, the women will be able to support themselves and their families, and become stronger role models for future generations.

name: Cook Books
description:
More-With-Less
With recipes from a wide range of contributors, More-With-Less provides practical wisdom on how to prepare healthy meals while using fewer food resources. Popularized long ago, this special anniversary edition is peppered with anecdotes gathered from 25 years of cooking More-With-Less.

Extending the Table
Filled with enticing dishes from more than 80 countries, Extending the Table offers an eclectic mix of recipes interspersed with stories of how hospitality is practiced around the world. From rice fields in Indonesia to majestic peaks in Nepal, Extending the Table takes you to far off places without leaving the comfort of your own kitchen.

Simply in Season
Through wholesome and straightforward recipes, Simply in Season is helping thousands of people make the connection from field to table. Divided into seasons – as the title suggests – you’ll never have to guess when your favourite crop is ripe for the pickin’!


2208070 (Green)
2208090 (Purple)
2208050 (Orange)

name: Kisii Stone Wedding Sculpture
description:
The Kisii stone wedding sculpture from Kenya holds deep significance. The smaller loop symbolizes the bride. It is placed under the large loop (the groom) because the husband will be her hunter and protector for the rest of their lives. The two loops stand for the two individuals that have become joined through marriage but are still two individual people. Family or close friends give the sculpture to the couple on their wedding day. The traditional blessing that accompanies the sculpture says: May the union last as long as the stone from which the sculpture is carved.

Made in Kenya


Product Code: #V24072

name: Galimoto
description:
Galimoto! A fun word to say, a fun toy to play with. In Africa, homemade galimotos are fashioned by children out of anything from sticks to cornstalks, and can be vehicles of any sort. This one is made from wire, as galimotos often are. Watch the rider's legs "pedal" as the wheels move.

· Wire and cloth
· 24H inches (including handle)

Made in Kenya

About the Artist: OTIC, a privately held export and marketing company, seeks to help local artisans connect with export markets. OTIC provides export, packaging and quality control support for a number of small workshops in and around Nairobi. Artisans may receive training in wood carving or even small, no-interest loans.

name: Lucky Star Garland
description:
Fits a 37in doorway. Hangs 24in at the longest point.
Folded paper stars on double twisted string.

About the Artists:
The exceptional artisans of Prokritee come from one of nine job creation programs. In 2003, the handicraft and export arm of Mennonite Central Committee Bangladesh officially became a registered company called Prokritee, which aimed at empowering Bangladeshi leadership and generating income for the poorest people. Biborton Handmade Paper, Bonoful Handmade Paper, Shuktara Handmade Paper, Jobarpar Enterprises, Keya Palm Handicrafts, and Mrinmoy Pottery are a few of Prokritee's job creation programs. In addition to providing much needed jobs, all of these groups offer literacy courses and training in childcare, health, nutrition, and leadership development as well as savings funds for the artisans and loans at low interest rates.

name: Global Maps
description:
Made in U.S.A.

About the Maps:

What's up? South! World Map:
This south-at-the-top map is a great educational tool. It challenges basic notions of ''up'' and ''down.'' True ''up'' from our standpoint on the earth, is away from the center, and the earth in space has no inherent up or down. To emphasize this point, this map includes an inset, which shows global views from various angles. In addition, other inset maps show examples of a variety of projections with notes on their merits and limitations.
Standard size is 36'' x 56''

ODT25

"Peter's Projection" Map:
Which is bigger, Greenland or China? With the traditional Mercator map Greenland and China look to be the same size but in reality China is almost 4 times larger! In response to such discrepancies, Dr. Arno Peters created an equal area map, a new world map that dramatically improves the accuracy of how we see the Earth. 
Standard size is 35'' x 50''

ODT24

Equal Area Map of the U.S.A.:
See the USA in true size! True proportion! 
Desktop Map: 13.5 '' X 22 '' 
Great for drilling on states and capitals. Copyright-free outline map on the reverse. 

P222

World Population Map:
This is a map of world populations: the larger the country, the bigger its population. Each grid square represents a million people. 
Standard size is 35'' x 52''

ODT24

description:
Always losing your eyeglasses? Never again! When they’re not on your face, put them on this one. Shesham wood face makes the perfect eyeglasses rest and an amusing conversation piece.

· Shesham wood
· 3Lx3Wx6H inches

Made in India

About the Artists: Archana Handicrafts is a private business committed to helping Indian artisans by encouraging, developing and selling their traditional handicrafts. Archana means "a thing of truth and beauty" in the Sanskrit language. Headquartered in New Delhi, Archana markets products from artisan groups throughout India. Artisan groups range from single members to families to entire villages making brass and shesham wood items. Archana assists craftspeople with banking, design, training and management. The organization is committed to the principle of fair trade, and strives to practice fair trade throughout its supply chain, giving artisans a better standard of living. Archana supports small businesses as a way to help family artisans stay and thrive in their home villages. Archana encourages environmentally sustainable practices.

name: Square Kaisa Casserole Basket
description:
Handle your 9-inch square casserole dish in comfort and style with this hand-woven casserole basket from Bangladesh. Basketry container is convenient, and attractive on your dinner table.

• Kaisa grass
• 9SQ inches

Made in Bangladesh

About the Artists: Dhaka Handicrafts in a self-sustaining development project founded in 1976 by EDM Handicrafts, a Swiss international development organization. The project supports the use of traditional basket weaving and pottery techniques. The sale of these products helps to improve the lives of disadvantaged and impoverished rural traditional craftsmen and women in Bangladesh. It also supports the viability of traditional craftsmanship in the modern world market place.

Product Code: #6600040

name: Kaisa Rectangular Casserole Basket
description:
Protect your hands and table from the heat, and add some beauty to the dinner setting. Handmade rectangular basket fits your 9x13 casserole. Kaisa is a wild grass used in Bangladeshi basket making. This very sturdy grass dries from its natural light green to a very pale almost tan color.

· Hand woven kaisa grass
· 9x13 inches

Made in Bangladesh

name: TIBETAN PRAYER FLAGS
description:
This classic Tibetan prayer flag is hand silk screened on cotton for Tibet Collection by the Tibetan Nuns Project in Dharamsala, India. A portion of each purchase helps to provide them with a safe environment for furthering their studies. This flag has contains five mythical animals (clockwise from the upper left, Dragon, Garuda, Snowlion, Tiger and the Windhorse in the center), plus the eight auspicious signs. The origin of printing prayer flags in Tibet is said to date back to the 11th century. The hanging of prayer flags is thought to promote good fortune and to dispel danger. In Tibet, they are called Lung-ta or Windhorse, named for the traditional character who carries the prayers to the universe. On his back are the triple gems of Buddhism «Éœ Buddha (teacher), Dharma (teachings) Sangha (monastic followers). The five flag colors represent the five elements: Blue - earth, White - water, Red - fire, Saffron - infinite space and Green - wind. Enjoy the slow fading of color as they hang in the elements. To dispose of old flags with respect, please burn them. (16''h x 11''w x 5'l) 

About the artists: The aim of Tibetan Nuns Project is to provide food, clothing, housing, basic medical care and education to refugee nuns from Tibet and Himalayan regions of India.

Product Code: L #TZ1 M #TZ3 S #TZ10 T #TZ9

name: Onyx Apple Paperweight
description:
Let this glossy hand-carved apple tempt you. Rich grained onyx stone makes a sturdy apple paperweight with a copper stem.

· Onyx with copper stem
· Color may vary
· 2Dx2H inches

Made in Pakistan                           

About the Artists: Dominion Traders works with underprivileged artisans who make stone and shesham wood crafts in the city of Karachi. It disperses orders to independently owned and operated onyx workshops that own their own equipment and rent or own their facilities. Most are family businesses employing several family members. These workshops are scattered throughout Pakistan, and employ artisans of different religions and creeds who work together in cordial relationships. Benefits to artisans include profit-sharing, pension plans and medical benefits. Dominion Traders provides interest-free loans and advances to artisans. The late Mansoor Ali founded Dominion Traders, using business management skills he learned from his father. Mansoor Ali was also the pioneer in introducing fair trade practices in the stone industry in Pakistan. Unusually for Pakistan, he chose to hire artisans regardless of religion or ethnicity. Now, Syed Fahad Ali, son of Mansoor Ali, is following his father’s footsteps in managing Dominion Traders.

Product Code: #7435040

No need for a lampshade – translucent onyx lamp features a bulb socket inside stone holder. Lighted lamp brings out the beauty of variegated onyx stone. Low wattage bulb required.

· Onyx
· Low wattage bulb required – 40W or lower
· 5Dx9H inches

It disperses orders to independently owned and operated onyx workshops that own their own equipment and rent or own their facilities. Most are family businesses employing several family members. These workshops are scattered throughout Pakistan, and employ artisans of different religions and creeds who work together in cordial relationships. About the Artists: Dominion Traders works with underprivileged artisans who make stone and shesham wood crafts in the city of Karachi. It disperses orders to independently owned and operated onyx workshops that own their own equipment and rent or own their facilities. Most are family businesses employing several family members. These workshops are scattered throughout Pakistan, and employ artisans of different religions and creeds who work together in cordial relationships. Benefits to artisans include profit-sharing, pension plans and medical benefits. Dominion Traders provides interest-free loans and advances to artisans. The late Mansoor Ali founded Dominion Traders, using business management skills he learned from his father. Mansoor Ali was also the pioneer in introducing fair trade practices in the stone industry in Pakistan. Unusually for Pakistan, he chose to hire artisans regardless of religion or ethnicity. name: Cut Metal Musician Statue made in Haiti
description:
Folk art musician plays her guitar, surrounded by animals. Beautifully realized free-standing sculpture is made from cut metal ironwork. This original art form comes from
Croix des Bouquets, a small village outside of Port-au-Prince, where cut metal art has been produced from recycled oil drums since the early 1930s.

• Cut metal, brown finish
• 13Wx33H inches

Made in Haiti                          

About the Artists: The nonprofit CAH, Comité Artisanal Haitien or Haitian Committee of Artisans, markets and exports crafts made by Haitian artisans, cooperatives and craft groups. The artisans whose work CAH promotes have organized themselves in a variety of ways. Some are cooperative associations, some are family workshops and some are independent artisans; all depend on the efforts of CAH to market their handicrafts for a fair wage. In 1999 CAH became part of the “Fondation pour le Developement de l’Artisanat Haitien.” CAH provides marketing and promotional expertise, training in literacy and business skills for artisans, fair wages and advances on orders, and financial assistance in case of health emergencies. CAH artisans sell their work locally to tourists, and for export through the fair trade market.

Product Code: #8002070

name: Handmade daily News Hot Mat
description:
All the news that’s fit to weave – artisans’ careful handwork makes a beautiful and effective hot mat from recycled newspapers. Paper is coiled around broom bristle, joined with thread and glue, then starched for durability. Mats will stand up to heat and moisture that comes with average use.

· Recycled newspaper
· 12Lx9W inches

Made in the Philippines             

About the artists: The artisans of Women’s Multipurpose Co-op create woven, crocheted and knitted items, home decor items and recycled newspaper products, Christmas decorations made of pine needles, and baskets indigenous to local communities. The cooperative helps women artisans work together in groups, obtain government help in skills training, buy raw materials, gain access to low interest loans and obtain titles to their land. Women's Multipurpose Co-op is affiliated with the Cooperative Development Authority and is an affiliate of the Philippine Exporters Confederation.

The cooperative helps women artisans work together in groups, obtain government help in skills training, buy raw materials, gain access to low interest loans and obtain titles to their land. Women's Multipurpose Co-op is affiliated with the Cooperative Development Authority and is an affiliate of the Philippine Exporters Confederation.

Product Code: #7904060

name: Recycled Coiled Paper Bowl
description:
Adapted from a traditional basket-making technique, this bowl is made with recycled posters from a printing company. Artisans form the paper into flat strips, dip them in a glue mixture and hang them to dry. After this they re-wet the strips and coil them into a bowl form. The strips are held together with the glue, forming a sturdy bowl.

• Recycled posters
• Dry food only
• 11Dx2H inches

Made in Vietnam                          

About the Artists: Mai Vietnamese Handicrafts is a nonprofit organization that provides income generating and marketing services to Vietnamese artisans. The company runs several craft production projects and markets the work of numerous other craft producers. During recent years, it has established itself as the primary marketing agent for artisans from neglected families and women. It practices a model of social development in which social service cannot be separated from economic self-reliance. Mai Handicrafts sales fund various community development activities, including clean water projects, vocational training equipment and teacher wage subsidies. Mai Handicrafts artisans receive social and health insurance, and can apply for scholarship funds.

name: Mayan Paper Journal
description:
We are manufacturing the paper Huun and its derivatives since 1994 in the heart of the Maya area, in Mérida, Yucatán, Mexico.
since 1985 the founder, Mark Callaghan, began field research in the Yucatan Peninsula on the various regional renewable resources plants for development of a new handmade paper. 
Spotted a functional combination between the ancient Japanese technique washi and ancient Mayan technique to perform this role. Huun role in Mayan means was the name of the tree used by the Maya of Yucatan ancestors make your proto-also known as amate paper in the center of the country.


We create with this alternative ecological quality craftsmanship and beauty with Huun paper plant.
